FuncDef:
The rule command creates or modifies an ACL rule in the user-defined ACL view.
The undo rule command deletes an ACL rule in the user-defined ACL view. The rule command creates or modifies an ACL rule in the user-defined ACL view. The undo rule command deletes an ACL rule in the user-defined ACL view. By default, no user-defined ACL rule is created.
CLIs: rule [ <rule-id> ] [ name <rule-name> ] { deny | permit } [ [ [ [ l2-head ] <rule1> <rulemask1> <offset1-l2> [ <rule2> <rulemask2> <offset2-l2> [ <rule3> <rulemask3> <offset3-l2> [ <rule4> <rulemask4> <offset4-l2> ] ] ] ] | [ ipv4-head <rule1> <rulemask1> <offset1-ipv4> [ <rule2> <rulemask2> <offset2-ipv4> [ <rule3> <rulemask3> <offset3-ipv4> [ <rule4> <rulemask4> <offset4-ipv4> ] ] ] ] | [ l4-head <rule1> <rulemask1> <offset1-l4> [ <rule2> <rulemask2> <offset2-l4> [ <rule3> <rulemask3> <offset3-l4> [ <rule4> <rulemask4> <offset4-l4> ] ] ] ] ] | [ time-range <time-name> ] ]

undo rule [ name <rule-name> ] { deny | permit } [ [ [ [ l2-head ] <rule1> <rulemask1> <offset1-l2> [ <rule2> <rulemask2> <offset2-l2> [ <rule3> <rulemask3> <offset3-l2> [ <rule4> <rulemask4> <offset4-l2> ] ] ] ] | [ ipv4-head <rule1> <rulemask1> <offset1-ipv4> [ <rule2> <rulemask2> <offset2-ipv4> [ <rule3> <rulemask3> <offset3-ipv4> [ <rule4> <rulemask4> <offset4-ipv4> ] ] ] ] | [ l4-head <rule1> <rulemask1> <offset1-l4> [ <rule2> <rulemask2> <offset2-l4> [ <rule3> <rulemask3> <offset3-l4> [ <rule4> <rulemask4> <offset4-l4> ] ] ] ] ] | [ time-range <time-name> ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an ACL rule.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967294.

Specifies the name of an ACL rule.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters that cannot begin with an underscore (_), spaces not supported.

Denies packets that match conditions.
-

Permits packets that match conditions.
-

Indicates that the offset starts from the Layer 2 header.
-

Specifies a user-defined rule string.
The value must be a hexadecimal number and start with 0x. The length ranges from 3 to 10 digits.

Specifies the mask for a user-defined rule string.
The value must be a hexadecimal number and start with 0x. The length ranges from 3 to 10 digits.

Specifies an offset that starts from the header.
The value is an integer, ranging from 2 to 114, in bytes.

Specifies a user-defined rule string.
The value must be a hexadecimal number and start with 0x. The length ranges from 3 to 10 digits.

The value is an integer, ranging from 2 to 114, in bytes.

The value must be a hexadecimal number and start with 0x. The length ranges from 3 to 10 digits.

Specifies an offset that starts from the header.

Indicates that the offset starts from the IPv4 header.
-

Specifies an offset that starts from the header.
The value is an integer, ranging from 0 to 96, in bytes.

Specifies an offset that starts from the header.
The value is an integer, ranging from 0 to 96, in bytes.

Specifies an offset that starts from the header.
The value is an integer, ranging from 0 to 96, in bytes.

Specifies an offset that starts from the header.
The value is an integer, ranging from 0 to 96, in bytes.

Indicates that the offset starts from the Layer 4 header.
-

Specifies an offset that starts from the header.
The value is an integer, ranging from 0 to 96, in bytes.

Specifies an offset that starts from the header.
The value is an integer, ranging from 0 to 96, in bytes.

Specifies an offset that starts from the header.
The value is an integer, ranging from 0 to 96, in bytes.

Specifies an offset that starts from the header.
The value is an integer, ranging from 0 to 96, in bytes.

Specifies a time range during which an ACL rule takes effect.
A time range is configured using the time-range command.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Cancel current setting.
-

Specifies an end rule ID for user-defined ACL rules to be deleted in batches.to-rule-id must be greater than rule-id.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967294.

ExtraInfo: After an ACL is created, run the rule command to add rules to the ACL.
